articles.headline: On the Patience Required in Awaiting Publication
articles.author: Publius
articles.preview: There exists a peculiar virtue in the deliberate delay of publication, for it allows the author time for reflection and the reader time for anticipation.

articles.headline: On the Virtue of Testing Systems
articles.author: Publius
articles.preview: It is a truth universally acknowledged among those who labor in the construction of mechanical systems, that no edifice of logic may be trusted until it has been subjected to rigorous trial.

articles.headline: On the Accumulation of Executive Power
articles.author: In the Style of Thomas Paine
articles.preview: When the executive branch of government begins to accumulate powers beyond those granted by the constitution, the citizens must take notice. For it is in the nature of power to expand, as water seeks the lowest ground...
